content:
Tumor microenvironmental factors (e.g., hypoxia, acidosis) impair DSB repair by downregulating repair gene expression and altering chromatin structure, increasing genomic instability and neoplasia, and these features can be exploited for selective therapy.  
*Supporting evidence:* Hypoxia downregulates DSB repair genes and promotes tumorigenesis [Bindra 2004]. Hypoxic tumors are sensitive to DNA repair inhibitors [Chan 2010, Cancer Res].

---
